description: {"blocks":[{"key":"du3ri","text":"This is the High Efficiency Transformation Protocol for C3019H and C3019I cells. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"69qoi","text":"Transformation Protocol Variables","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":33}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4lr6o","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7l7sr","text":"Thawing: Cells are best thawed on ice and DNA added as soon as the last bit of ice in the tube disappears. Cells can also be thawed by hand, but warming above 0°C will decrease the transformation efficiency.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"29fbu","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c8mhn","text":"Incubation of DNA with Cells on Ice: For maximum transformation efficiency, cells and DNA should be incubated together on ice for 30 minutes. Expect a 2-fold loss in transformation efficiency for every 10 minutes this step is shortened.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":35}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"14jc6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e6nk5","text":"Heat Shock: Both the temperature and the timing of the heat shock step are important and specific to the transformation volume and vessel. Using the transformation tube provided, 30 seconds at 42°C is optimal.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3405n","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9ngej","text":"Outgrowth: Outgrowth at 37°C for 1 hour is best for cell recovery and for expression of antibiotic resistance. Expect a 2-fold loss in transformation efficiency for every 15 minutes this step is shortened. SOC gives 2-fold higher transformation efficiency than LB medium; and incubation with shaking or rotating the tube gives 2-fold higher transformation efficiency than incubation without shaking.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ff6i5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bl8an","text":"Plating: Selection plates can be used warm or cold, wet or dry without significantly affecting the transformation efficiency. However, warm, dry plates are easier to spread and allow for the most rapid colony formation.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cvv2s","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2smea","text":"DNA Contaminants to Avoid","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":25}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cbu67","text":"ContaminantRemoval MethodDetergentsEthanol precipitatePhenolExtract with chloroform and ethanol precipitateEthanol or IsopropanolDry pellet before resuspendingPEG*Column purify or phenol/chloroform extract and ethanol precipitateDNA binding proteins (e.g. Ligase)Column purify or phenol/chloroform extract and ethanol precipitate","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":25}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":329}],"data":{}},{"key":"frl5f","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tables","mutability":"","data":{"cellsMeta":{"0_0":"","0_1":"","1_0":"","1_1":"","2_0":"","2_1":"","3_0":"","3_1":"","4_0":"","4_1":"","5_0":"","5_1":""},"colWidths":[228,50],"data":[["\u003cstrong\u003eContaminant\u003c/strong\u003e","\u003cstrong\u003eRemoval Method\u003c/strong\u003e"],["Detergents","Ethanol precipitate"],["Phenol","Extract with chloroform and ethanol precipitate"],["Ethanol or Isopropanol","Dry pellet before resuspending"],["PEG*","Column purify or phenol/chloroform extract and ethanol precipitate"],["DNA binding proteins (e.g. Ligase)","Column purify or phenol/chloroform extract and ethanol precipitate"]],"guid":"FB236030458411E99CE33B990B794995","legend":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"aup0a","text":"* Ideally, DNA for transformation should be purified and resuspended in water or TE. However, up to 10 µl of DNA directly from a ligation mix can be used with only a two-fold loss of transformation efficiency. Where it is necessary to maximize the number of transformants (e.g. a library), a purification step, either a spin column or phenol/chloroform extraction and ethanol precipitation should be added.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}},"mergeCells":[],"rowHeights":[23,23,23,23,23,23],"show_headers":true}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7aid4","text":"Pipette   into the mixture. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":8,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"9qda4","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"f2emr","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"950","guid":"251EE7A0A8A511EA8CB20A58A9FEAC2A","id":0,"label":"room temperature NEB 10-beta/Stable Outgrowth Medium","unit":1}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"97pof","text":"NEB 10-beta/Stable Outgrowth Medium gives 2-fold higher transformation efficiency than LB medium.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":9,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":15,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":38,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"cjltv","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":3,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"158oc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"251EF057A8A511EA8CB20A58A9FEAC2A","id":0,"label":"","temperature":"37","unit":10}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"","data":{"duration":3600,"guid":"251EF0FCA8A511EA8CB20A58A9FEAC2A","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null,"temperature":"37","unit":10}},"2":{"type":"centrifuge","mutability":"","data":{"centrifuge":"250","duration":0,"guid":"251EF224A8A511EA8CB20A58A9FEAC2A","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null,"temperature":"","temperatureUnit":10,"unit":33}},"3":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"dv0cp","text":"Outgrowth at 37°C for 1 hour is best for cell recovery and for expression of antibiotic resistance. Expect a 2-fold loss in transformation efficiency for every 15 minutes this step is shortened. Incubation with shaking or rotating the tube gives 2-fold higher transformation efficiency than incubation without shaking.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d2mq2","text":"Warm selection plates to  .  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":25,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"18qum","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"251F1F58A8A511EA8CB20A58A9FEAC2A","id":0,"label":"","temperature":"37","unit":10}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"e80p7","text":"Selection plates can be used warm or cold, wet or dry without significantly affecting the transformation efficiency. However, warm, dry plates are easier to spread and allow for the most rapid colony formation.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"4d71q","text":"Mix the cells thoroughly by flicking the tube and inverting.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d79q3","text":"Perform several 10-fold serial dilutions in NEB 10-beta/Stable Outgrowth Medium.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"59rau","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"3phg5","text":"Please note that NEB no longer recommends SOC for use in this protocol. NEB 10-beta/Stable Outgrowth Medium is now provided with NEB 10-beta Competent E.coli and available also as a stand-alone product.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"a856i","text":" ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7pub3","text":"Spread  -  of each dilution onto a selection plate.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":7,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":9,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"50","error":false,"guid":"251F1543A8A511EA8CB20A58A9FEAC2A","id":0,"label":"","unit":1}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"100","guid":"251F169AA8A511EA8CB20A58A9FEAC2A","id":0,"label":"","unit":1}}}}
